Articles.Content:
I was conducting a failed experiment on base construction.  I have a "vessel" on Minmus with a habitat module, a battery, a docking port and some solar cells.  It also has resource transfer pipes.

I didn't notice that I ended up with a resource transfer pipe in  the middle of the ladder.  My Kerbal was climbing up the ladder (RCS off) and bumped into the unattached pipe--and tipped the whole module by something like 30 degrees!

If my spacesuit had bootstraps I should be able to pull myself into orbit with them!

Kerbal physics are amazing.  Their mass is a constant but their momentum fluctuates as a property of time and your desire for order...

*nods sagely*
